blocks.text: The Problem: What If We Want Different Styles?
This is great, but what happens when we have multiple elements of the same type? Let's add two subtitles to our page and try to make them blue.

blocks.code:
Hello World

Sub heading 1

Subheading 2

blocks.text: If you save and refresh, both subtitles will be blue. But what if we want the second subtitle to be green? Our current method, the element selector (`h2`), is too general.
To target specific elements, we can give them a special label using the class attribute in HTML. Think of it like giving a nickname to a tag. A class name can be anything you want (without spaces).

blocks.code:
Hello World

Sub heading -1 < /h2>

Subheading -2
